cab.content: Special Work of the Local Government Board for the week ended 21st December, 1917.-1. The Representation of the People Bill has been read a second time in the House of Lords.2o Notice has been given in Parliament of a Bill to extend and amend the National Registration Act, 1915.3. The Board are in communication with the Food Controller as to the issue of a Defence of the Realm Order empowering local authorities to supply milk free or on special terms to necessitous infants and nursing mothers subject to regulations of the Board, and with the Treasury as to grants being made towards the expenditure of local authorities on such supply.4. In view of the need for economy in the use of petrol an Order has been issued amending the Motor car Orders to facilitate the use of trailers carrying gas-containers for the propulsion of heavy motor cars.5. A representative of the Board has been nominated to serve on a Committee appointed by the Minister of National service to advise him in connection with questions relating to the employment of aliens.
